tldr: The author, John Swinton, describes his process of deciphering Palmyrene inscriptions and the Palmyrene alphabet. He discovered twenty-one letters of the Palmyrene alphabet and could translate seven of the thirteen inscriptions drawn in the Palmyrene character. The inscriptions were found on statues and altars, and the dialect used is most certainly the Syriac.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
